intro: Atitara orthacantha, commonly known as the sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in sandy or disturbed soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, pink or purple blooms. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes used in landscaping for its ornamental value.
